resources:
MedGuidelines Child-Pugh Score A-drop Colorectal cancer TNM classification (UICC 8th) Search < 2 2 to 3 > 3 > 3.5 2.8 to 3.5 < 2.8 < 1.7 1.7 to 2.3 > 2.3 absent slight moderate none grade 1 or 2 grade 3 or 4 No Yes Age: Male >= 70, Female >= 75 No Yes BUN > 21 mg/dL or dehydration No Yes SpO<sub>2</sub> < 90% or PaO<sub>2</sub> < 60 mmHg" No Yes Consciousness disorder No Yes Systolic pressure < 90 mmHg" Bilirubin (mg/dL) Serum total bilirubin Albumin (g/dL) Albumin (g/dL) Prothrombin (INR) Prothrombin (INR) Ascites Ascites Encephalopathy grade Grade 1: Trivial lack of awareness, Euphoria or anxiety, Shortened attention span, Impairment of addition or subtraction, Altered sleep rhythm. 
Grade 2: Lethargy or apathy, Disorientation for time, Obvious personality change, Inappropriate behavior, Dyspraxia, Asterixis. 
Grade 3: Somnolence to semistupor, Responsive to stimuli, Confused, Gross disorientation, Bizarre behavior. 
Grade 4: Coma Mild, outpatient care Moderate, outpatient or hospital care Severe, hospital care Most severe, ICU admission T factor N factor M factor Tis T1 T2 T3 T4a T4b N0 N1a N1b N1c N2a N2b M0 M1a M1b M1c Tis: intramucosal, T1: submucosa, T2: muscularis propria, T3: pericolorectal, T4a: perforate cisceral peritoneum, T4b: invade or adherent to adjacent organs or structure. N1a: 1, N1b: 2–3 regional nodes, N1c: Tumour deposit(s), i.e. satellites,* in the subserosa, or in non‐peritonealised pericolic or perirectal soft tissue without regional lymph node metastatic disease, N2a: 4–6, N2b: 7 or more regional nodes. M1a: one organ without peritoneal metastases, M1b: more than one organ, M1c: to the peritoneum with or without other organ involvement.
